name: Blumenthal Bros. & Co. v. Richard W. Bacon, Appellant

judges: Before Sterrett, C. J., Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
parties: Blumenthal Bros. & Co. v. Richard W. Bacon, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Dean,
The facts in this case being the same as those of same plaintiffs v. William Whitaker, opinion filed this day, the law is the same and the judgment is affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Dean,

casebody.head_matter:
Blumenthal Bros. & Co. v. Richard W. Bacon, Appellant.
Argued Jan. 24, 1895.
Appeal, No. 192, by defendants, from the order of C. P. No. 2, Phila Co., March T., 1894, No. 804, making absolute a rule for judgment for want of a sufficient affidavit of defense.
Before Sterrett, C. J., Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
Affirmed.
October 7, 1895:
